add_edge(source, target, attr_dict=None, directed=False, popup=None, k=None, **attr)[source]¶
add_edge_style(source, target, attr_dict=None, directed=False, color='#000000', width=1.0, arrow_shape='triangle', edge_style='solid', arrow_fill='filled')[source]¶

Add the style for the given edge in the style json.

source: string – unique ID of the source node target: string – unique ID of the target node color: string – hexadecimal representation of the color (e.g., #000000), or the color name. Default = black. directed: bool - if True, draw the edge as directed. Default = False. width: float – width of the edge. Default = 1.0 arrow_shape: string – shape of arrow head. Default is “triangle” edge_style: string – style of edge. Default is “solid” arrow_fill: string – fill of arrow. Default is “filled”

Returns:
Return type:None
add_node(node_name, attr_dict=None, label=None, popup=None, k=None, **attr)[source]¶
add_node_style(node_name, attr_dict=None, content=None, shape='ellipse', color='#FFFFFF', height=None, width=None, bubble=None, valign='center', halign='center', style='solid', border_color='#000000', border_width=1)[source]¶

Add the style for the given node in the style json.

Parameters:
  • node_name (string - name of the node.) –
  • shape (string -- shape of node. Default = "ellipse".) –
  • color (string -- hexadecimal representation of the color (e.g., #FFFFFF) or color name. Default = white.) –
  • height (int -- height of the node's body. Use None to determine height from the number of lines in the label. Default = None.) –
  • width (int -- width of the node's body, or None to determine width from length of label. Default=None.) –
  • bubble (string -- color of the text outline. Using this option gives a "bubble" effect; see the bubbleeffect() function. Optional.) –
  • valign (string -- vertical alignment. Default = center.) –
  • halign (string -- horizontal alignment. Default = center.) –
  • style (string -- style of border. Default is "solid". If Bubble is specified, then style is overwritten.) –
  • border_color (string -- color of border. Default is #000000. If Bubble is specified, then style is overwritten.) –
  • border_width (int -- width of border. Default is 4. If Bubble is specified, then style is overwritten.) –
Returns:
Return type:

None
static check_color_hex(color_code)[source]¶

Check the validity of the hexadecimal code of various node and edge color related attributes.

This function returns an error if the hexadecimal code is not of the format ‘#XXX’ or ‘#XXXXXX’, i.e. hexadecimal color code is not valid.

Parameters:color_code – color code

static set_edge_color_property(edge_properties, color)[source]¶

Add a edge color to the edge_properties.

Color both the line and the target arrow; if the edge is undirected, then the target arrow color doesn’t matter. If it’s directed, then the arrow color will match the line color.

Color can be a name (e.g., ‘black’) or an HTML string (e.g., #00000).

Parameters:
  • - Dictionary of edge attributes. Key/value pairs will be used to set data associated with the edge. (edge_properties) –
  • - string -- hexadecimal representation of the color (e.g., #FFFFFF) or color name. (color) –
Returns:
Return type:

Dictionary of edge attributes.
Raises:

Exception - if the color is improperly formatted.

  • - bool - if True, draw the edge as directed. (directed) –
  • - string -- shape of arrow. See ALLOWED_ARROW_SHAPES. (arrow_shape) –
Returns:
Return type:

static set_node_bubble_effect_property(node_properties, color, whitetext=False)[source]¶

Add a “bubble effect” to the node by making the border color the same as the text outline color.

Parameters:
  • - Boolean -- if True, text is colored white instead of black. Default is False. (whitetext) –
  • - string -- hexadecimal representation of the text outline color (e.g., #FFFFFF) or a color name. (color) –
  • - Dictionary of node attributes. Key/value pairs will be used to set data associated with the node. (node_properties) –
Returns:
Return type:

Dictionary of node attributes.

static set_node_height_property(node_properties, height)[source]¶

Add a node height property to the node_properties. If the height is ‘None’, then the height of the node is determined by the number of newlines in the label that will be displayed.

Parameters:
  • - Dictionary of node attributes. Key/value pairs will be used to set data associated with the node. (node_properties) –
  • - int -- height of the node's body. Use None to determine height from the number of lines in the label. (height) –
Returns:
Return type:

Dictionary of node attributes.

static set_node_label_property(node_properties, label)[source]¶

Set the label “label” to a “node_properties” dict and return the “node_properties” dict. The label is stored under “content” in the node information. Also set wrap = ‘wrap’ so newlines are interpreted.

node_properties - Dictionary of node attributes. Key/value pairs will be used to set data associated with the node. label - text to display on node. “

” will be interpreted as a newline.

Dictionary of node attributes.
static set_node_shape_property(node_properties, shape)[source]¶

Add a shape property “shape” to the node_properties.

Parameters:

  • - string -- shape of node. Default = "ellipse". (shape) –
Returns:
Return type:

Dictionary of node attributes.
Raises:

Exception - if the shape is not one of the allowed node shapes. See ALLOWED_NODE_SHAPES global variable.

static set_node_width_property(node_properties, width)[source]¶

Add a node width property to the node_properties. If the width is ‘None’, then the width of the node is determined by the length of the label.

Parameters:
  • - Dictionary of node attributes. Key/value pairs will be used to set data associated with the node. (node_properties) –
  • - int -- width of the node's body, or None to determine width from length of label. (width) –
Returns:
Return type:

Dictionary of node attributes.
static set_node_wrap_property(node_properties, wrap)[source]¶
Adding node wrap allows the newline ‘

‘ to be interpreted as a line break for the node.

node_properties - Dictionary of node attributes. Key/value pairs will be used to set data associated with the node. wrap - string denoting the type of wrap: one of “wrap” or “none”.

Dictionary of node attributes.

Exception - if the wrap parameter is not one of the allowed wrap styles. See ALLOWED_NODE_TEXT_WRAP for more details.

static validate_property(element, element_selector, property_name, valid_property_values)[source]¶

Goes through array to see if property is contained in the array.

Parameters:
  • element (Element to search for in network) –
  • element_selector (selector for element in the network) –
  • property_name (name of the property) –
  • valid_property_values (List of valid properties) –
Returns:

  • None - if the property is valid or does not exist
  • Error message - if the property is not valid
